title: Becoming toxic, need jusus
body: Hi ive noticed been becoming more and more angry playing league and it has translated into the chat. ive been saying some pretty harsh things (none of your typical flaming) and i want to stop before i get banned i love playing the game but it can make me frustrated Thanks.

replies.body:
Hey summoner,

It's great to hear you want to reform! I'd like to give you some specific tips though, rather than just listing a bunch of broad [general stuff](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behaviour/K57wEEW0-self-improvement?comment=0001) that we've done before, if that's ok.

I'll need you to answer a few of these questions so we can understand your situation a little better (leave anything you don't want to answer blank):

1. Are you getting angry at people who are legitimately trolling/insulting you? Or  are you getting angry at people who are doing badly in lane?

2. Does this happen in ranked, normals or both?

3. Do you have /allchat enabled? and how often do you use the mute button?

4. Do you play with friends often?

5. And lastly, what's the most severe restriction you've received? (gives us an idea of how quickly we need to act)

Attach your replies to this comment if you'd like, or add me in-game and send some of your answers there :D

Hmm sounds like the issue I had a few years ago. 

Here's what worked for me:

1. **End on a good note.**
One of the things that triggered me was that I was queuing up expecting a negative experience (like a bad team), so when anything slightly negative happened I'd just mentally give up. 

 What helped me curve that back was making sure I ended each day on a good note. If I wanted to play 5 games but the 3rd game was rewarding, I'd just stop there and practice CSing or watch streams. 

 After a while I noticed that I won more games and I was going into games thinking _"I can totally carry this"_.  How you end an experience actually has a massive physiological impact.

2. ** Play less seriously with more friends!**
 I think you should be playing with friends every second day. I know you might write this off as useless advice, but you'll find yourself raging less if you make a serious effort to play more with good friends. 

 Also by "playing with friends", I don't mean just adding them to the game. I mean getting in voice chat with them and talking while you play. Playing experimental champion picks also helped me completely de-stress the experience.

Remember you won't see effects immediately from stuff like this. It's going to take at least a week to get over your current attitude towards League and then maybe you'll see results in the next week.

Also I wouldn't worry too much about being punished. It's obviously not a good thing, but if you're genuinely trying to reform the actual punishment might come as a good reminder when you're about to flame in-game.
